sentences.sContent: a deliberate attempt to humiliate her
The attack on him was quite deliberate.
sentences.sCn: 对他的袭击完全是有预谋的。

sentences.sContent: ...Data on management expenses at the college system and in other state departments will be part of a “business justification” the state will use as officials deliberate the specifics of an outsourcing plan...
...They range from minor cases of deliberate damaging of things to much more serious offenses...

synos.tran: 故意的；深思熟虑的；从容的

remMethod.val: de ＋ liber(自由的) ＋ ate → 做事不随便的 → 深思熟虑的

trans.tranCn: 故意的， 蓄意的； 慎重的， 深思熟虑的

trans.tranOther: to think about something very carefully
